paper_abstract: A graph G is said to be equitably k-colorable if there exists a proper k-coloring of G such that the sizes of any two color classes differ by at most one. Let Delta(G) denote the maximum degree of a vertex in G. Two Brooks-type conjectures on equitable Delta(G)-colorability have been proposed in Chen and Yen (Discrete Math., 2011) and Kierstead and Kostochka (Combinatorica 30:201-216, 2010) independently. We prove the equivalence of these conjectures.
paper_title: Equivalence of two conjectures on equitable coloring of graphs
